Activity: Log in to the system, check emails. Skim through articles on data validation techniques.
Focus on lab results and prescription data elements. Add these elements to the existing checklist.
Extend the SQL query to include lab results (e.g., influenza test results) and prescription data. Consider how to handle different lab result formats (e.g., positive/negative vs. numerical values).
Analyze the lab result data. Identify inconsistent results (e.g., positive result without corresponding symptoms). Document findings.

Investigate the prescription data. Ensure that prescriptions are appropriate for influenza treatment based on diagnosis and patient demographics. Consult with @pchmp-1 if needed on clinical appropriateness.
Draft an email to @mrs-1 and @mrs-2 to understand the procedures for handling missing or incomplete lab results. Ask about processes for requesting missing information from external labs.
Continue developing the test plan, adding test cases for lab result and prescription data. Focus on edge cases and boundary conditions.
Review and update the overall data quality report. Prioritize the identified data quality issues based on severity and potential impact on influenza trend analysis.
Discuss the test plan with @qatest-2 to gather feedback and ensure comprehensive coverage.
Prepare the plan for tomorrow's activity, focusing on cross-validation strategies.
